page.title: 19TOMATO GROWING.
page.content: The Jones family of Chilton Cantelo own a tomato farm.This farm was formed after World War 2.There are 7 acres of land mainly covered by greenhouses. They have a continuous succession of ripe tomatoes by using the method of planting in March and October. Over the whole area a total of 55,000 plants are grown but not all of these develop into healthy plants. Some are hit by white fly which feeds off of the plant and will eventually kill it if left untreated. The only way to get rid of this pest without harming the plant is to spray them with Enserica. Most plants are grown in rock wool and a few in water. Each plant is fed with fertilizer to ensure a good crop. Some plants can grow up to 30 feet long. The company produces 280,000 pounds of tomatoes a year which are sold to two local firms.
